input.description: XML document conforming to the ConnectionDetails Concept that contains the information required to execute a command. Example: <BladeLogicConnectionDetail> <adapter-name>BladeLogic Adapter</adapter-name> </BladeLogicConnectionDetail>
Handle identifying a particular job run.

Format for presenting time. The start time is formatted using Java's SimpleDateFormat patterns. (See getEndTimeByRunKey for a similar command that provides the start time in Java date format.) The following list briefly describes SimpleDateFormat patterns. The first item in the list labels components of subsequent items in the list. - Letter--date piece--example - y--year--05,2005 - M--month--Aug,August,08 - d--day of month--15 - H--hour of day (24h format,0-23)--16 - m--minute of hour--35 - s--second of minute--21
Other possible patterns are: - Letter--date piece--example - z--time zone (general)--EDT - Z--time zone (RFC822)-- -0400 - E--day of week--Wed,Wednesday - G--era--AD - w--week of year--35 - D--day of year--156 - W--week of month--3 - F--day of week of month--2 - a--am/pm-- PM - k--hour of day(1-24)-- - K--hour of AM/PM(0-11)-- - h--hour of AM/PM(1-12)-- - S--Millisecond--
For example, for the date of 5 Aug 2005, 2:40:56 PM on a client in the Eastern time zone, a format string of "yyyy/MM/dd HH:mm:ss" produces the output 2005/08/05 14:40:56.

output.description: Success status of the command. "true" if successful, "false" otherwise.
If "success" is false then error message contains the corresponding error message if any.
Contains formatted start time for a job run.
Contains any debug message accompanying the adapter response.
Contains the output part of the adapter response.

documentation.description: This command gets the start time for a job run. You must provide the handle for the job run. If the format parameter is not provided then this command provides the start time in Java date format. For example, a job start time of 8:41:11 AM on 5 Aug 2005 for a client located in the Eastern time zone is displayed as -- Fri Aug 05 08:41:11 EDT 2005. See getEndTimeByRunKey for a similar command that provides the start time in Java's SimpleDateFormat. You can use any of the following to get the jobRunKey: JobRun findLastRunKeyByJobKey JobRun findRunKeyById
